We cannot turn our backs on those who put their lives on the line for our nation. I introduced the PAWS Act which will close a loophole to allow veterans suffering from mental illness to benefit from a service dog. #NationalPTSDAwarenessDay Read more here: http://bit.ly/HopeOnTheHorizon …
84 Senators from both sides of the aisle, including Democrat leadership, voted in favor of the package. The House should follow suit and send this to the President's desk.

We can address the crisis on our southern border today. The Senate has passed a bipartisan package with $4.6 billion in humanitarian aid, including funds to take care of children and to hire judges to clear the backlog and give families a chance to have their claims heard. pic.twitter.com/UoKYy8bsQ8

Families wouldn't be separated, children wouldn't be detained indefinitely if asylum cases were processed in a timely fashion. Let's treat the cause, not just the symptoms.

(2/2) If you are a veteran and would like your story to be included in the Library of Congress, call my office at (202) 225-2015 to set up a time to be interviewed by a member of my staff.

#ExIm helps businesses in #OH15 compete with China, and its reauthorization is important for our local economy. I want to thank @PatrickMcHenry for working with members of @FinancialCmte to draft a bill that represents the priorities of our districts.

Today I had the honor to welcome Sarah Karns, the #OH15 2018 and 2019 Congressional Art Competition winner, back to DC where she met with other winners from around the nation. I am grateful for the opportunity to have met with members of Refugee Council USA earlier this year. These mothers are exactly why we must create a timely and effective system. pic.twitter.com/kc6OPF6lJm

Today we recognize #RefugeeDay, highlighting the importance of finding solutions for the refugee crisis of more than 22.5 million refugees, over half being children. Even the founders of our nation were religious refugees, seeking opportunity and a better life for their families.

Justice delayed is justice denied. Over 700,000 migrants are being denied justice due to the unacceptable backlog of asylum cases. Congress must do more to give those individuals and families the certainty they deserve from the United States. pic.twitter.com/qVadj8J62t

On the 75th Anniversary of D-Day, it is time to reflect and honor the brave men and women of who stand as an example of hope for all those who value freedom. Over 160,000 Allied troops landed along the French coastline and 9,000 Allied soldiers were killed or wounded.
